results.title: Contract Reform: The Missing Link in Trinidad and Tobago’s Energy Resurgence
results.summary: This letter to the editor emphasizes the importance of legislative reform within Trinidad and Tobago's oil and gas sector to support long-term, transparent, and investor-ready growth. It highlights the need for standardized contracts that align with ESG principles, climate change considerations, and sustainable development, drawing lessons from Guyana's legal disputes. The author, Vanna Jankiepersad, advocates for modernizing petroleum legislation and incorporating international best practices to maintain the country's competitive edge in the global energy landscape. results.title: Visa free travel to Bermuda revoked for Trinidad and Tobago nationals
results.summary: Bermuda has revoked visa-free access for Trinidad and Tobago nationals, effective July 17, 2025, requiring a valid US, UK, or Canadian visa for entry. The decision follows the replacement of the Bermuda Immigration and Protection Order 2025 by the Ministry of Economy and Labour. This change aligns Bermuda with recent visa policy adjustments by the United Kingdom and Ireland. Nationals can enter Bermuda with valid travel authorization to Canada, the United States, or the United Kingdom, or with a letter verifying their status as a spouse of a Bermudian or affiliation under Section 11(5) of the 1968 Bermuda Constitution Order.
